meanings.definition: To place on a throne as a king or queen.
meanings.sent1: The king was enthroning his son as the new ruler of the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the queen was enthroning her successor with a crown.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully imagined enthroning itself as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, she was enthroning her favorite book as the best in her collection.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's words about kindness were enthroning in the students' hearts.

meanings.definition: To invest with sovereign or episcopal authority.
meanings.sent1: The bishop was enthroning the new priest with his blessings.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony involved enthroning the king with the royal scepter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel amusingly imagined enthroning the acorn as the ruler of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was enthroning the new manager with decision-making power.
meanings.sent5: The oath of loyalty was enthroning the knight with his duty to the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To exalt or elevate to a position of power or honor.
meanings.sent1: The community was enthroning the local hero for his bravery.
meanings.sent2: The promotion ceremony was about enthroning the employee to a higher rank.
meanings.sent3: The child jokingly imagined enthroning the family pet as the household leader.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work was enthroning her as the top student in the class.
meanings.sent5: The victory in the championship game was enthroning the team as the best in the league.
